summary: I have more 25 years of experience in the petrochemical industry. I have both operational and engineering experience at several processing facilities. Most of my operational experience was gained in refineries in South Africa where I was involved in projects engineering, production technology, on-line plant optimisation & modeling and long-term refinery environmental master planning. At Jacobs I am responsible for implementing HSE in design. My creativity, broad experience and technical expertise enables me to come up with innovative, yet practical solutions.

projects.title: Heavy Atmospheric Gasoil (HAGO) Project, Ireland
projects.description: IOW will develop a new HAGO (Heavy Atmospheric Gas Oil) unit which will upgrade heavy atmospheric gasoil from the crude distillation unit into ultra-low sulphur diesel (ULSD) products. Interface involves several existing units and utilities.  As DHSE consultant, tasks involved safe equipment design and engineering, passive and active fire protection, plot spacing & safety layout, model reviews, safety signs, fire & gas detection, hazardous area classification, human factors engineering (ergonomics), health risk assessments, noise, ATEX and explosion protection, dispersion and heat radiation effects, emission control, drainage systems, development of safety philosophies, approval & close out of all HSE related actions, ALARP demonstration.

projects.title: Marzahn Berlin System East Project, Germany
projects.description: Hired by Vattenfall, via Jacobs, as Design HSSE manager to provide DHSE expertise to the Vattenfall project team on a project to the build a highly efficient natural gas fired CCHPP to provide 300 MW electrical power and 230 MWth heat output to the district heating grid. As HSSE manager for Vattenfall, additional tasks involved reviewing bids for completeness, bid evaluations, bid clarifications, ranking for shortlisting of bidders, negotiations and assessment of re-bids, ranking and selection of preferred bidder and contract preparation. Once the contractor was selected, provided HSSE expertise and management of the project on behalf of Vattenfall.

projects.title: TAKREER Waste Heat Recovery Project, Abu Dhabi
projects.description: This was an energy-efficiency optimization project to generate additional power and desalinated water whilst maintaining the current fuel gas consumption. The scope of the Project was to recover waste heat to produce more power & water for improving energy efficiency and reducing environmental impact. As Design HSSE manager for TAKREER, tasks involved integration and management of HSE in the project including management of third party consultant for permit application.

profile_positions.description: Principal Design HSE consultant on EPC projects for various clients in Europe and the Middle East.  Effective management of Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) issues during the development, engineering and construction of projects. Each project has a unique set of HSE expectations determined by the project's scope and schedule. These expectations are set within a framework of legislative requirements, industry guidelines and company standards. The integration and management of HSE is done from project conception through all phases of project development to ensure that project goals are met without compromising health, safety or the environment.

profile_positions.description:
Technologist on several refinery units: Provided technical support to production (operations) department with respect to process trouble shooting and optimizing unit performance. Main focus of the job was to work closely with SHELL and BP with the aim of improving the business giving due attention to economic aspects in addition to the technological aspects.
Optimization technologist: Developed a data reconciliation (DATACON) and optimisation model (using SimSci 's flow sheeting program PROMOTE - PRO/II) of the main crude distillation unit which included the Crude Distiller, Naphtha Hydrotreater, Gas Plant and High Vacuum Unit. 
Environmental Masterplanning Technologist: Main task was to develop an environmental masterplan to  make SAPREF the best in class E refiner. A high degree of self-motivation was required since the masterplan was started from grassroots.

profile_positions.description: Job functions included conceptual engineering with the focus on creative thinking, problem solving and process optimisation. Basic engineering was done in conjunction with all the other engineering disciplines in the project team as well as with the clients (Sasol Two and Sasol Three Refineries). Team work was essential to ensure the success of cost effective projects. Projects included simulations, debottlenecking of several refinery units, problem solving (long and short term) and process modifications.

profile_positions.description: Worked in Process Department and reported to Senior Engineer. Prepared pinch point list for all units in refinery. Designed and drew flow diagrams for new plant modifications including all required specifications e.g. sizing of control valves, orifices, relief valves, pumps and pipes. Calculated crude mixes for product and distillate tanks. Prepared Lube, Sulphur and Amines plants, daily monitoring reports and advised on corrective measures to be taken to improve production rates and quality. Calculated daily production. Compiled monthly fuels production reports providing full explanation for the nature of events on behalf of the Technical Manager. Compiled monthly SO2 reports. Worked during plant shutdowns ensuring that all equipment internals were correctly placed and of correct specifications.
